author: abdoulline
body:
As discussed at HCAL DPG on Friday
https://indico.cern.ch/event/795881/ 
current M0 timing is suboptimal both for Phase1 collisions and for Cosmics/Splashes, as it uses 
(i) Phase0 tabulated corrections for old HPD shape 
(ii) timing adjustment from obsolete DB conditions. 

Both (i) and (ii) are now removed, SOI reference is kept for collisions, while removed for Cosmics/Splashes. MC Cosmics-config and collisions [*] tests (including debugging printout inspection of ~100 ev) show expected behaviour: M0 timing vs energy is narrow and stable above several GeV.     

--------
[*]
NB: green is for new M0 timing, red for current default MAHI one.
The latter is a pending issue  https://github.com/cms-sw/cmssw/issues/25526  and now is being revised.
